project.name: obsd
project.author: Grant Goodyear
project.description: Running Gentoo on an OpenBSD base system.

longdescription.p: An effort to provide a true Gentoo experience on top of a base OpenBSD system. The first step was to create a tarball of portage + support apps so that portage would function on OpenBSD; that has been finished for a while. The next step was to create an iso to make installation easier; also finished. Current efforts are focusing on getting sandbox ported to the *BSD libc and slowly patching packages (and, in some cases, portage itself) to handle the BSD libc and filesystem heirarchy. The next "big" item on the todo list is to hack the Gentoo init scripts so that they can be run from OpenBSD's init.

Head on over to the
Gentoo + *BSD
page for more information.
This project is still in its infancy. If you are interested in working on it, please send an e-mail to Grant Goodyear.
